item.title: Convert Utf 8
item.description: ##This is a Bash script used to convert all GBK-encoded text files in a specified folder and its subfolders to UTF-8 encoding. # Define a function for recursively processing files in a folder process_files() { local path="$1" local file # Traverse files in the folder for file in "$path"/*.txt; do if [ -f "$file" ]; then # Check if the file encoding is UTF-8 encoding=$(file -b --mime-encoding "$file") if [[ "$encoding" == "utf-8" ]]; then echo "File '$file' is already in UTF-8 format, skipping conversion.
